GAUTENG DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT
 
Department of Social Development Bursaries and Financial Assistance for Study Purposes - 2024
 
The Gauteng Department of Social Development is offering bursary opportunities to deserving students who reside in Gauteng to promote skills development and quality education. Students must excel academically have a passion to pursue a career in the Social sector.

Bursaries will be awarded within the following fields of study to students who are not currently benefiting from any other bursary scheme:
• Community Development.
• Financial Management.
• Demography and Population Studies.
• Clinical Psychology; and
• Occupational Therapy.
 
The bursary will cover the following expenses: registration, tuition, prescribed books, and study material.
The selection of candidates will be based on, but not limited to the following:
• Permanent residents within the Gauteng Province for at least one year prior to application,
• South African citizen,
• Currently studying or intend on studying full-time in one of the listed fields,
• Accepted to study at a recognized tertiary institution,
Application forms can be collected and submitted at any Gauteng Social Development office/institution.
 
Youth from all race and gender groups, youth leaving child and youth care facilities as well as youth with disabilities who meet the minimum entry requirements are encouraged to apply.

Application forms can be collected and submitted at any Gauteng Social Development office/institution.
 
The following documents should accompany applications:
Certified ID document, certified Matric certificate, certified copies of all education qualifications, proof of tertiary acceptance/proof of registration, motivational letter, proof of residence, Parents / Guardians proof of income (pay slips or affidavit if unemployed. Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) voting district verification printout (that indicates the voting station and ward details) accessible from the IEC website: https://www.elections.org.za/pw/
 
All successful applicants will be required to enter into contractual agreements with the Department.

The National Credit Regulator (NCR) was established as the regulator under the National Credit Act 34 of 2005 (the Act) and is responsible for the regulation of the South African credit industry.
